data.meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.
data.sentence: The word كَانُوا comes from the root ك و ن and is associated with the meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.
The word مَا comes from the root م ا and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: To be right, just or fitting, worthy of, justly due to, proper, genuine, real, a fact, true, necessitated, suitable, necessary, incumbent upon, suited to the requirement of justice, become certain, authentic, deserve.
data.sentence: The word الْحَقُّ comes from the root ح ق ق and is associated with the meanings: To be right, just or fitting, worthy of, justly due to, proper, genuine, real, a fact, true, necessitated, suitable, necessary, incumbent upon, suited to the requirement of justice, become certain, authentic, deserve.

data.meanings: to do/make/act/work/operate/perform/construct/manufacture, practice a handcraft, be active, one who does.
data.sentence: The word يَعْمَلُونَ comes from the root ع م ل and is associated with the meanings: to do/make/act/work/operate/perform/construct/manufacture, practice a handcraft, be active, one who does.

data.meanings: to fall down, befall, come to pass, be conformed, happen, take place, ascertain.
data.sentence: The word فَوَقَعَ comes from the root و ق ع and is associated with the meanings: to fall down, befall, come to pass, be conformed, happen, take place, ascertain.

data.meanings: Becoming false, untrue, wrong, incorrect, fictitious, spurious, unfounded, unsound, vain, unreal, worthless, futile, unprofitable, ineffectual, devoid of virtue, null, void or of no accountA thing perishing or becoming lostBecoming idle, unoccupied or without workDiverted from profitable enterprises (in this life or the next)Jesting, joking or not serious in conversationBecoming or being courageous, brave, strong hearted (in war or fight)Pursuit of vain, frivolous diversion or sport, ignorant conductIblees, Satan, devils or enchantersOne who says a thing in which there is no truth or reality, embellishing speech with lies.
data.sentence: The word وَبَطَلَ comes from the root ب ط ل and is associated with the meanings: Becoming false, untrue, wrong, incorrect, fictitious, spurious, unfounded, unsound, vain, unreal, worthless, futile, unprofitable, ineffectual, devoid of virtue, null, void or of no accountA thing perishing or becoming lostBecoming idle, unoccupied or without workDiverted from profitable enterprises (in this life or the next)Jesting, joking or not serious in conversationBecoming or being courageous, brave, strong hearted (in war or fight)Pursuit of vain, frivolous diversion or sport, ignorant conductIblees, Satan, devils or enchantersOne who says a thing in which there is no truth or reality, embellishing speech with lies.
